You are my son. Out of love and affection for you, out of filial affection and with the intention of providing you with some fixed wealth, I hereby bequeath to you the property as per the schedule below, namely, the ancestral property of my husband and your father Palivela Srinu garu, who enjoyed full rights during their lifetime and passed away intestate without any written documents. Dated 16-10-2019. Accordingly, their subsequent Hindu Succession Rights have been transferred to us from that date to this day. I hereby transfer the said property to you on this day, free of charge, without any compensation from you, and grant you possession of the said property. From now on, you shall take possession of the said property and pay all the taxes payable to the Panchayat and enjoy it freely and without any hindrance, with all the full rights of donation and sale, for the benefit of your children and grandchildren, throughout your generations. The property shall be entered in the accounts of the Gram Panchayat in accordance with the schedule. I hereby declare that I will remove all the feudal encumbrances, whether they arise from anyone or not, at my own expense and will make this property available to you without any hindrance. This settlement deed is written and given in your name stating that the property is an undisputed property not subject to any other kind of written or verbal expressions.
This property has not been aspirated by the Government. This property has not been given any guarantee by the Government or any Government institution or any non-Government institution.
A.P. Government Act No. 9/77 is not applicable to this property.
I hereby declare that the property transferred by this deed does not include any trees or plantations like mango, coconut, sweet potato etc., minerals like granite etc., or stone mines and if any such facts are found in this, I will be prosecuted as per law. I hereby declare that I am responsible for the payment of excise duty and agree to do so. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 611 of 2026 dated 27/Jan/2026, executed by Palivela Satyavathi in favour of her son Palivela Satish, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 71-66 Sq.Yds, bearing house number 4-194, comprised in survey number 140/1, situated in Kondagunturu Village & Panchayati, Rajanagaram Mandal, within the District of East Godavari registered at sub-registrar office Rajanagaram is bounded as follows: North by: Tata Pallavi property, 21.6 Sq. Ft South by: Panchayathi Road, 21.6 Sq. Ft East by: Jaka Hemalatha property, 30 Sq. Ft West by: Dasu Mounika property, 30 Sq. Ft
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
